content.description: Stand start matched however comfortable in the undercut seam. Make several barndoory moves on small feet to a juggy horizontal which provides the opportunity to psych yourself up or out. Enjoy the remaining 10+ feet of exposed, featured climbing to an airy mantle.While the problem is tall, the built up landing makes it so falling is an option. Even so, it's probably best to just figure out the top on a rope. A large block on top can be slung to build a quick gearless anchor. One of the best highball moderates in the Black Hills.
content.protection: As many pads as you need for mental pro. Landing drops off steeply, but was leveled out with logs for the FA.
content.location: Start in the obvious seam feature in the middle of the steep west face.

content.description: Somewhat of a summit block for the area, the top of this formation offers excellent views of the Grizzly Bear Creek drainage and Iron Mountain area. The steep face holds Lord Grizzly, V5, and has the potential for more difficult steep highballs. Stays dry and warm in the winter as long as the sun is shining.
